greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Iterate A080670 starting at n; a(n) = number of steps to reach a prime, or -1 if no prime is ever reached.
comment: If n is a prime, a(n) = 0.
a(20) is presently unknown - see A195265 for the trajectory.
example: 9 -> 32 -> 25 -> 52 -> 2213, which is prime, taking 4 steps, so a(9) = 4.
xref: Cf. A080670, A195264 (the prime that is reached), A195265, A067599, A037271 (home primes).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 27 2013
